proverbs.yoruba: Bi omode ba subu, a wo iwaju
proverbs.meaning: When a child falls, he looks ahead
proverbs.literal: When a child falls, he looks forward
proverbs.context: Used to encourage forward-looking after mistakes.

proverbs.yoruba: Agba ki wa loja, ki ori omo tuntun wo
proverbs.meaning: An elder cannot be in the market and a child’s head bends wrongly
proverbs.literal: An elder cannot be in the market and a child’s head bends wrongly
proverbs.context: Shows elders’ responsibility over the young.

proverbs.yoruba: Omi ni o wà lórí omi
proverbs.meaning: Water sits on top of water
proverbs.context: Used when similar things group together.

proverbs.yoruba: Omi ni o wà lórí omi
